import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Get filter set"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/filters/sets/{filterId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Retrieves a single filter set (a stored collection of filter criteria) by ID, including its type, entity type, scope, and match rules. Use this to load saved view filters, automation rule conditions, or custom field visibility logic when you already have a filter set identifier.

**Prerequisites**
1. **filterId** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/filters/sets/for/type/\{FilterSetType\}](/docs/api/filters/get-filter-sets-by-type) or [POST /api/v1.0/filters/sets/ids/get](/docs/api/filters/get-filter-sets-by-ids) to obtain filter set IDs.

**Workflow Example**
1. List filter sets by type and select a `FilterSetId`.
2. Fetch the full filter set: [GET /api/v1.0/filters/sets/\{filterId\}](/docs/api/filters/get-filter-set).
3. If you need the concrete selected values, call [GET /api/v1.0/filters/sets/\{filterId\}/values](/docs/api/filters/get-filter-set-values).

**Minimal Required Fields**: filterId (path).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"filterId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"},"description":"The filterId parameter"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
